net.sourceforge.jaad.mp4.boxes.impl

Class HandlerBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.jaad.mp4.boxes.BoxImpl
      • net.sourceforge.jaad.mp4.boxes.FullBox
        • net.sourceforge.jaad.mp4.boxes.impl.HandlerBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Box

    public class HandlerBox
extends FullBox
    This box within a Media Box declares the process by which the media-data in the track is presented, and thus, the nature of the media in a track. For example, a video track would be handled by a video handler. This box when present within a Meta Box, declares the structure or format of the 'meta' box contents. There is a general handler for metadata streams of any type; the specific format is identified by the sample entry, as for video or audio, for example. If they are in text, then a MIME format is supplied to document their format; if in XML, each sample is a complete XML document, and the namespace of the XML is also supplied.

      • decode

        public void decode(MP4InputStream in)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: BoxImpl
        Decodes the given input stream by reading this box and all of its children (if any).
        Overrides:
        decode in class FullBox
        Parameters:
        in - an input stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading

      • getHandlerType

        public long getHandlerType()
        When present in a media box, the handler type is an integer containing one of the following values:
        • 'vide': Video track
        • 'soun': Audio track
        • 'hint': Hint track
        • 'meta': Timed Metadata track
        When present in a meta box, it contains an appropriate value to indicate the format of the meta box contents. The value 'null' can be used in the primary meta box to indicate that it is merely being used to hold resources.
        Returns:
        the handler type

      • getHandlerName

        public java.lang.String getHandlerName()
        The name gives a human-readable name for the track type (for debugging and inspection purposes).
        Returns:
        the handler type's name
